item.title: Go Daily Question 106
item.author: loommii
item.description:
Regarding loop statements, which of the following statements are correct? ()

A. Loop statements support both the for keyword, and while and do-while; B. The basic usage of the for keyword is no different from that in C/C++; C. for loops support continue and break to control the loop, but it provides a more advanced break that allows choosing which loop to interrupt; D. for loops do not support multiple assignment statements separated by commas; multiple variables must be initialized using parallel assignment;
